abstract: Guard From Above, Netherlands-based security start-up, is teaching eagles and other birds of prey to safely take down small, off-the-shelf drones to prevent unmanned aerial vehicles from compromising aircraft, dropping contraband in jails, spying or committing terrorist activities; Dutch authorities are expecting to deploy birds soon and other police departments around globe are considering their use.
lead_paragraph: When small, off-the-shelf models pose security or other threats, birds have the advantage of grounding them without a potentially dangerous crash.

headline.main: Dutch Firm Trains Eagles to Take Down High-Tech Prey: Drones
headline.print_headline: Eagles Trained to Take Down High-Tech Prey: Small Drones

snippet: When small, off-the-shelf models pose security or other threats, birds have the advantage of grounding them without a potentially dangerous crash.
